hints.content: The mass of the shark is $\greenD{650}$ kilograms.
The mass of the sea lion is $\maroonD{325}$ kilograms.

We can find the total mass of the animals by adding the mass of the shark $(\greenD{650\text{ kg}})$  to the mass of the sea lion $(\maroonD{325\text{ kg}})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total mass. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 650 kilograms. The shorter right part is labeled 325 kilograms. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Shark. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Sea lion. !

hints.content: The mass of the animals combined is $975$ kilograms.

question.content:
Finn works at an aquarium. He weighs the shark and the sea lion (shown below).  

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**What is the mass of the shark and the sea lion combined?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] kilograms

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a shark with a starting major tick mark of 0 kilograms and the additional 7 major tick marks labeled 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, and 700. There are 3 minor unlabeled tick marks between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the shark on the scale is at the second minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 600. !

A hanging scale weighing a sea lion with a starting major tick mark of 0 kilograms and the additional 7 major tick marks labeled 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, and 700. There are 3 minor unlabeled tick marks between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the sea lion on the scale is at the first minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 300. !
